intro: Ichnanthus amplus, commonly known as the broad-leaved water-plantain, is a flowering plant species native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that float on the water surface. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in shallow, freshwater environments. Ichnanthus amplus plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
